content.description:
Shared start with Dry Rain/Gomer/Hopelessly Trapped in the Negro Vortex.

After the roof, climb the left leaning crack with a small bush in itÂ to the top.

Another fun crack climb on Wonder Bluffs.  This is just to the left of Conniption and climbs up to and through the lower-left cave.  Climb straight out of the cave and follow the vertical crack above.

Climb the crack, right of "Gypsy".

Rappel from slings.

climbs.name: Rings Around Your Danus
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Cyndie Bransford, Dana Adler

content.description: This climbs the next crack system right of Pencil Neck Geek. The climbing is forgetable.
content.protection: small to large. We lowered or rapped from something at the top of the climb.
content.location: Right most route on the Wonder Bluffs.

climbs.name: Pencil Neck Geek
climbs.fa: John Long and Keith Cunning, December 1979

content.description:
The Wonder Bluffs is an east-facing wall split by many crack systems, some of which are quite good.

Near the far right side of the wall and 5' right of an obvious left-facing corner is this straight-in crack which starts thin (crux) and slowly widens higher. The descent is either a walk-off to the climber's right or a rap from bolts located in the middle of the wall.

A nice place to escape the mobs found at so many easily approached crags. This is a good wall to work on crack skills with several other good routes nearby. It can get cold here in the winter if the wall is shady, but it is usually quite nice.

climbs.name: Hopelessly Trapped in the Vortex
climbs.fa: John Long and Keith Cunning, December 1979

content.description: After the start, follow slanting cracks up and left. There are many fun, exposed moves, largely hand jamming and liebacking.
content.location: Start to the right of center on the wall, at the same place as Gomer Pile and Dry Rain.

content.description:
This route starts in a chasm on the far left side of the cliff. This follows a thin crack to a ledge.

Rappel 40' from slings.

climbs.name: Gomer Pile
climbs.fa: John Long and Keith Cunning, December 1979

content.description: Climb "Dry Rain" until reaching a flake/thin crack that goes up and left. Climb this.

This is the left-facing corner left of

Pencil Neck Geek

and follow cracks to chimney.

climbs.name: Conniption
climbs.fa: John Long and Keith Cunning, December 1979

content.description:
This great crack climb, starts two cracks right of "Slam Dunk".

There are two small caves, an upper and lower one to the left.

Climb a slightly curving thin crack to the upper (right) cave. Chimney out of the cave and jam an excellent hand crack to the top.

climbs.name: Bluewind
climbs.fa: John Long and Keith Cunning, December 1979

content.description: This is the crack just to the right of "Conniption".
